THE UNIVERSITY OF CONNECTICUT
STORKS. CONNECTICUT
March 25, 1953
Mr, Robert E. Underwood, Jr*
Network Manager
NAEB
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Mr. Underwood:
Thank you for your prompt action on our series, "Stretching Your
Family Income." I wish commercial stations would react in the same
manner in situations of this natureJ
Enclosed you will find the 5 copies of your application form,
which I hope are filled in correctly. If you need any additional
information or copies of the reprints, please let me know.
I may not have mentioned that the Kazanjian Foundation (one of
the 3 sponsoring organizations) would be happy to supply a limited
number of the reprints to persons requesting them near the end of
the series, if it is carried by some or all of your member stations.
These would be available on a first come, first serve basis, and I
canâ€™t yet give you an indication as to the exact number that would
be available- it will depend somewhat on the number of markets
invttlved.
We certainly hope that the board will decide favorably on this
series- it has brought excellent response during its presoitation on
WTIC- and if you would care to write to Paul Lucas, Vice President for
Radio, WTIC, Hartford I5, Connecticut, I'm certain he would back me
up 100^.
Again my thanks for your courteous and prompt attention; I hope
we can do business.
Radio-Tv Supervisor
